components are delivered to a factory in large batches. the quality assurance manager uses the 
following double sampling plan for each batch delivered. 
 
a random sample of 10 components is examined and if there are fewer than 2 defective

batch is rejected. if exactly 2 of the components are defective then a second random 
sample of 10 components is examined. if there are no defective components in this 
second sample, then the whole batch is accepted; otherwise it is rejected. 
 
(a) find the probability of accepting a batch where the proportion of defective components is 
 
 
(i) 10%, 
(ii) 
15%.

 (b) show that, using this plan, the expected proportion of defective components actually
